topic.title: Add-ons For Technical Documentation
topic.shortdesc: Oxygen XML Author has various free and useful add-ons for technical documentation writers, including a language model for editing, batch document converter, Git client, content fusion connector, feedback comments manager, terminology checker, DITA translation, and live tutorials. ## Language Model for Editing The language model add-on assists writers by providing advanced grammar and style suggestions, ensuring that the documentation is clear, concise, and free of errors. It integrates seamlessly with Oxygen XML Author, offering real-time feedback as you type. ## Batch Document Converter The batch document converter add-on allows users to convert multiple documents from one format to another in a single operation. This is particularly useful for large projects where consistency and efficiency are key. Supported formats include DITA, DocBook, and XHTML. ## Git Client The Git client add-on provides a user-friendly interface for managing version control directly within Oxygen XML Author. It supports all standard Git operations, such as cloning repositories, committing changes, and merging branches, making it easier for writers to collaborate on documentation projects. ## Content Fusion Connector The Content Fusion connector add-on enables seamless collaboration between writers and reviewers. It allows for real-time editing and commenting, ensuring that feedback is incorporated quickly and efficiently. This add-on is essential for teams working on complex documentation projects. ## Feedback Comments Manager The feedback comments manager add-on helps writers keep track of comments and suggestions from reviewers. It provides a centralized location for managing feedback, making it easier to address issues and improve the quality of the documentation. ## Terminology Checker The terminology checker add-on ensures consistency in the use of terms throughout the documentation. It scans the content for predefined terms and suggests corrections where necessary, helping to maintain a professional and uniform style. ## DITA Translation The DITA translation add-on simplifies the process of translating DITA documents into multiple languages. It supports various translation workflows and integrates with popular translation management systems, ensuring that the documentation is accessible to a global audience. ## Live Tutorials The live tutorials add-on offers interactive tutorials and guides directly within Oxygen XML Author. These tutorials cover a wide range of topics, from basic usage to advanced features, helping writers to quickly become proficient with the tool.

body.p:
Oxygen XML Author can be enhanced by installing add-ons. There are a large number of free and useful add-ons for technical documentation writers and we will explore some of them. Documentation and installation instructions for all Oxygen add-ons can be found here.
Use the Oxygen AI Positron service based on ChatGPT to enhance your editing experience.
Fluenta DITA Translation Add-on Create and manage XLiff files from your DITA XML content using the Fluenta libraries.
Create translation projects
Convert DITA XML to XLiff
Convert XLiff to DITA
Batch Documents Converter Convert various formats like Word, HTML, Markdown, DocBook, Open API, or Confluence into other formats like DITA XML.
Git Client add-on Collaborate with your colleagues on a Git project. Comes with support for:
Git Staging
Settings to validate before commit or before push.
Git History
Git Branch Manager
Content Fusion Connector Add-on Create review tasks for collaborators and subject matter experts who can later review the tasks in a web browser.
Feedback Comments Manager Add-on View and manage comments made in the Oxygen WebHelp Feedback forms directly in the Oxygen application.
Terminology Checker Add-on
Define terminology rules specific for your application to suggest replacements for certain combinations of words.
Use rules already implemented in Vale syntax.
Live Tutorials Add-on Create or explore already available tutorials to learn various Oxygen features.
DITA Prolog Updater Add-on Automatically update the author name and revision dates in the prolog section when saving DITA topics or maps in Oxygen.
DITA References View Add-on See the set of outgoing and incoming references for each opened DITA topic, including references defined in a relationship table.
